text: On tap at the brewery. Hazy amber to brown appearance with a light tan head. Aroma of dark fruity esters, bread, grains, light caramel/toffee and light chocolate malt. Similar flavor, adding hints of noble hops. Medium body with a light dry feel and a bittersweet finish. Solid Dubbel overall.

Keg at the Kings Arms, 14/11/16.
Chestnut brown with a decent beige cap.
Nose is toffee, ripe fruits, spice, dates, stewed fruits.
Taste comprises fruit loaf, dates, figs, brown sugar, toffee. nutty, light wooded twang.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid for style, never gets too sweet, good balance.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at the Kibgs Arms - London. Pours clear, deep gold with a lasting, foamy white head. The. Law holds ripening fruits, berries, bready malts, a little toffee. Medium sweet flavour with more bready sugars, toast, a little alcohol, caramel, golden raisins. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Fairly sweet in the finish, with more bready sweetness, low bitterness, berries, golden raisins, a little Belgian yeast. Quite solid overall.

Sample from draft at mikkeller friends, Poured hazy Brown with a tanned head. Nose of caramel malts, raisins, prunes, earth notes, Bread, light plum notes, and toffe. Taste is sticky, caramel, and lots of earthy Dried fruits

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy orange colored with a medium sized off-white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel, dried fruits, oak and berries.
Fruity flavor of caramel and dried fruits with notes of oak and berries with notes of alcohol.
Fruity finish.
From tap. Pours cloudy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is toasted malty, slight caramelish. Sweet caramelish and toasted malty. Mild bitter, sweet and caramelish malty finish.

Pour on tap at the brewpub, slightly hazy reddish pour with off white head, aroma brought notes of caramel, dark fruit, raisin, plum into a bit of spice, some yeasty notes into a bit of grass. Taste was a sweet mix of dark fruit, raisin, fig into some spice, yeast, toasted bread with a hint of caramel, slight grass, finishing sweet. Too sweet for my tastes.

draft, as a self-proclaimed dubbel aficionado, this is a good attempt, above average for the american verison but no westy 8, or chimay red at all. Different leagues. This is still characteristically nutty and caramel with a touch of dry smoke on thie finish which i enjoyed.
On draft. Brown with a red hue, one finger off white head. Raisin, figs, dark fruit aroma. Taste isnt as strong as Belgian versions, but still a pretty good dubbel.

Draft at brewpub. Deep dark ruby amber with creamy beige head. Medium plus body. Smooooth. Not overly malty or sweet. Fair dryness. Mild bitterness. Touch of spiciness. Yeast is working its magic. Good, quality brew.

Ive never been a fan of American-made dubbels and this is just another case of why. The belgian yeast character is completely missing and finishes too dry for my liking. I dont know where these people are getting sweet from but it definitely leaned towards bitter for me.  Doesnt smell like a dubbel either.
Like this one a lot. A bit sweeter than the style typically demands, but it works well here. Would love to see a quad from these guys.

[ Keg ][ Arizona Wilderness ][ 4oz ][ $1.50 ][ Mini Snifter ][ 4/11/14 ]
>> Clear deep red pour, webby silver lace. Nose is tomato and celery, phenols, black pepper. Taste has some celery, tomato soup. Not good. Did not enjoy.

Dark brown with reddish hue pour and small off white head. Aroma of malts, bread dough, slightly fruity. Taste of bready malts, slight prune, hint of caramel, Belgian yeast. Medium bodied, higher carbonation, perfectly balanced, slightly dry peppery finish. Nice solid dubbel!

On tap at the brewery. Pours dark, clear, mahogany with a light head that dissipates quickly. Light raisin, dates, and burnt sugar on the nose. The taste features a moderate plum tone, some brown sugar, light cinnamon, and dry clove and light bitter hops on the finish. Roasted malt takes over as the beer warms and is accompanied by a slight booziness. Solid dubbel.

Draft sample. Nice brown pour with ruby highlights and a small tan head. Aroma is baking chocolate and dark malt. Flavor trends towards the bitter side of espresso with some spice. A touch of booziness too. Good.

On tap: The aroma consists of raisin, figs, light chocolate, light brown sugar, and a hint of roasted nuts. It?s a transparent brownish-orange with a small off-white head that fades to a thin ring. The flavor starts with raisins, figs, and a touch of brown sugar. There?s a touch of chocolate in the middle. The finish has light citrus, a hint of roasted nuts, and spice. It?s medium bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel.

Poured up on tap at Wilderness where it has a very nice looking deep crystal clear ruby red body that supports a tan head of foam. The aroma is sweet with prunes and smooth figs and then lighter vaguely hoppy notes cut into the sweetness near the end of the draw. The taste has rich flavors of prunes, figs and a bit of brown sugar. It does maintain a slight tartness and hop bitterness to attempt to balance off the heavier sweeter notes. Toward the finish some roasted malts take over along with a sliver of nuttiness and create a nice balance against the sweetness into the finish. I enjoyed the degree of roastiness presented here.
Deep brown pour with slight haze. Aroma is light and malty. Flavors of brown sugar and dates.

Dark red pour, aroma from yeast is subtle which I like. Slight figgy, prune taste, but nothing over powering. Admittedly these belgian styles are not my favorite, but I could definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Well this is an incredible a ample of the style. Pours a nice brown color with a perfectly sized light head. Aroma has some nutty and sweet scents but it certainly doesnt smell sweet. And the flavor is spot on. Dates, figs, light brown sugar, some dark bread, and the finish is dry and beautiful.

Growler pours a reddish brown with a medium sized tan head. Aroma of spices, candi sugar, figs, belgian yeasts, bananas and cherries. Taste is spices, banana, candi-sugar, hops, dark malts, esthers and yeasts. Most dubbels are pretty sweet, this one walks the line between sweet and dry..... and I really appreciate how its not too cloying like most are. Really nice beer.

Dark red pour, fast dissipating off white head. Aroma of figs, Belgian yeast and some dates. Taste is sweet and dark fruity with a nice Belgian and sweet sugar flavor to accent. Enjoy this beer a hell of a lot!
